caseStudy.content:
Year: 2025

What I did: Branding, Web Design

Completed

In the nonprofit world there seems to be this big disconnect with trying to separate “serious” and trustworthy from energetic and relevant. So I took on Hunger Action Coaltion as a conceptual project to show that the two can live in harmony (in hindsight “THE” Hunger Action Coalition might've been a better name...)

caseBlocks.textBlock:
Gotta Start Somewhere

Normally, I'd do a whole lotta market / user / inner research, but in this case I gave myself 3 days to build out this (conceptual) organization from the ground up. So I dug deep into my past experiences to build a initial core pallette and a logo suite that met the organizations goals. Followed by a (probably way too early) sketch of a potential landing page.

From Neutral to Bold

So I can come up with some logos and pick out some colors… cool. The real question is how and where do they fit in? Well I knew that organizations love social media, but a lot suffer from the classic case of a non-cohesive voice on their platform of choice. My goal was to use this idea of “two voices” to create a collection of instagram templates that could be repurposed indefinitely.

Brand in Action

HAC needed the ability to show up everywhere. I got the social media covered, but I needed to show how they could show up from a poster on the street to letterheads for sending to the suits on capitol hill.

Website

With the brand fully showcased it made sense to create landing pages for the main site and for the volunteering page as the final deliverables of this sprint. The goal was to put all of the branding work together and create a site that adopts the duality of Hunger Action Coaliton.

Reflection

I’ll admit, this one was a little messy. I moved through research and design decisions quickly, but even at that pace, I created a two voiced system that I’d feel confident showing a client as a starting point for the next phase (refinement). The key takeaway here is that a nonprofit doesn't have to be so one note when it comes to branding.
